Package logic

Class LoggedInUser

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.LoggedInUser
  • public class LoggedInUser
extends java.lang.Object
    The class ensures the creation of a single user object in the system using Singleton. In addition ensures that a user will log in at any given time from a single account.
    Author:
    Yuval Hayam

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static LoggedInUser getInstance​(User user)  
      User getUser()  
      void logOff()
      in order to "logoff" the user, this method will put null in the singleton instance

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static LoggedInUser getInstance​(User user)
        Parameters:
        user - which contains information about a user who is logging in
        Returns:
        the singleton instance of the logged in user if the instance is null, will create a new one, by the singleton design pattern

      • getUser

        public User getUser()
        Returns:
        the logged in user if the singleton object is not null

      • logOff

        public void logOff()
        in order to "logoff" the user, this method will put null in the singleton instance
